condition.ab: The plate is well preserved and, aside from a crack slightly off center to the left, undamaged. Sand and calcium deposits obscure very little of the writing in parts of the lower edge and upper right hand side. The creases running vertically at regular intervals indicate that the tablet was rolled up.

handDesc.p: The script resembles W. Schubarts P. Berol. 43a (4th century A.D.) and the hand of the Bodmer Menander texts (3rd/4th century A.D.; cf. e.g. the specimen of Dyskolos in R. Seider, Palaeographie der griechischen Papyri II # 51, pl. XXVI).
